paragraphs.content: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is the man unto whom the LORD imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

paragraphs.content: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.

paragraphs.content: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.

paragraphs.content: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the LORD; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the Lord; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.

paragraphs.content: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.

paragraphs.content: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.

paragraphs.content: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.

paragraphs.content: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the LORD, mercy shall compass him about.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him about.

paragraphs.content: Be glad in the LORD, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
